intro: Diplostephium boreale, commonly known as the northern diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and meadows. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The showy yellow flowers appear in the summer and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
